name: Wax Plant
description: Hoya carnosa 'Krinkle 8' is a cultivar of Hoya carnosa, an epiphytic plant native to tropical regions of Eastern Asia, particularly China, Japan, and Korea. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and features trailing or climbing stems (60-300 cm long) with thick, waxy, dark green leaves with distinctive, crinkled texture and clusters of star-shaped, white to pink flowers. The flowers have a distinctive star shape with a waxy texture and often emit strong, pleasant fragrances, especially at night. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds tropical charm with its waxy, star-shaped flowers and trailing vines. It's extremely popular among Hoya enthusiasts for its easy care and attractive crinkled leaves.
careTips: Trailing or vining - provide support if needed
Can be propagated from stem cuttings
